title: We haven't had any demacia/noxus champions in a while
body: Correct me if i'm wrong, but the last one we had was darius, right?  I think that Riot is leaving this a bit in the dust because IMO it seems too black and white (noxus evil demacia good)

replies.body: {{champion:133}} was released after darius(heck Draven was directly released after Darius) and {{champion:236}} is actually a demacian,even if he doesn't work for demacia itself.
Yeah, but Lucian operates predominately as a Miscellaneous-type character - he doesn't particularly contribute anything to Demacia itself.

To be fair, the nations currently the third and second most represented in League are Demacia and Noxus, respectively; 8 champions are actually from Demacia, not just affiliated with it, and 10 are from Noxus fitting the same criteria. Ionia is currently the most represented, with 13 champions born in Ionia.

I think that these factions already being so well represented led to us exploring other locations for recent champs. But to the best of my knowledge, we aren't specifically trying to avoid Demacia or Noxus (or any other faction, for that matter).

That said, intentional or not, we HAVE ended up avoiding those factions. That's something Champion team is certainly aware of; it's just a matter of when it makes sense.

Are there specific things about Demacia or Noxus that you'd want their next champion to explore further?

That seems to be what most people would be interested in with the two factions, that they're not just good and bad. From a gameplay perspective, perhaps the Noxus character could be some kind of support who protects and heals his allies, yet was shunned outside of Noxus due to his "unholy" nature, and found happiness, love, and respect in Noxus? Demacia needs a stain on their pure white shirt. That's my point.
Draven is a marksman from Noxus. Sure, he doesn't use..........traditional weapons such as Cait, but he is still a marksman.

I think it would be interesting to have a champion who hails from one of those two nations, but doesn't directly epitomize the nation's ideals, perhaps even contradicts them. 

For example, what about corruption in Demacia's politics? It's easy to put in another Garen "JUSTICE, BE BOLD, RIGHTEOUSNESS!!!" or Jarvan "I AM ROYALTY, WE ARE THE RIGHTEOUS, BE SELFLESS FOR THE PEOPLE". 
What about someone who is lawful, but abuses the law to their own gain? "Justice is defined by the winners" "The law bends its knee unto me". 

Or what about someone who is honorable and potentially compassionate from Noxus? The only champion like this is Riven, but even then her story is a bit loose. Someone who trains very hard for a cause, who actually personifies becoming strong for the sake of altruism? Maybe they are naive about the cruel reality of Noxus? What if they aren't all about "crushing their foes" or "deceitfulness and secrets"? (Looking at these champs...{{champion:122}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:55}} )
Basically, I'm just looking for a Noxian who is earnestly and honestly strong, for the sake of being strong (and not Riven).

Even though the addition of this kind of champion (for either Demacia or Noxus) wouldn't represent the majority of their respective nation, it would give us a glimpse of the other side of those coins.
